section.title: Corpus repositories
section.p: The corpus is divided in a free part, where texts that we can redistribute are gathered, and a bound part, where we gather texts that we can't redistribute.

section.title: The free part
section.p: The free part is available in an svn repository that is world readable available on the address https://victorio.uit.no/freecorpus/.
Check out a working copy either by adding the above address to your svn program, or use the command line program like this: svn checkout https://victorio.uit.no/freecorpus.

section.title: The bound part
section.p: The bound part is available in an svn repository that is accessible only from the machine victorio.uit.no. This repository is readable by people that have signed our non disclosure agreement, and is writable by the corpus maintainers. The address to this repository is svn://victorio.uit.no/boundcorpus.
To check out a working copy, first login to victorio. Then issue the command svn co svn://victorio.uit.no/boundcorpus .

section.title: Manually adding content
section.p: If you have a file that you want to add to the corpus repository by hand you have to have a working copy of either the free or bound part of our corpus.

ol.li: If it is a freely distributable document, add it to the free part of our corpus. If not, add it to the bound part.
Determine the main language: eng, fin, nno, nob, sma, sme, smj, swe, and then genre: admin, bible, facta, ficti, laws, news.

Copy the file to the directory $working_copy/orig/$lang/$genre/. For example, a North Sámi document in genre "facta", copy the file to directory $working_copy/orig/sme/facta/ in your working copy. For the news genre, there are subdirectories for different sources of news, and for bible texts, there are subdirectories for ot and nt.
Copy the file $GTHOME/gt/script/XSL-template.xsl to $working_copy/orig/genre/$filename.xsl. Update the metainformation by editing this file.
Add and commit these files to the repository by either using the svn command line tools or your usual graphical interface to svn.

section.p: If you would like to have access our corpus, contact us at divvun@samediggi.no
